title: Brooklyn Tequila Fest
description: Discover, sip, and savor something new at the Brooklyn Tequila Fest! With more than 100 styles of tequila, mezcal, spirits, cocktails, and more, it’s a perfect chance to hang with friends and chat with distillers.
address: Brooklyn Navy Yard Building 77 Waterfront Promenade, 141 Flushing Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11205

title: Seventh Annual Mobile Dance Film Festival
description: The first film festival to screen dance films shot solely on mobile devices returns with 10 new shorts.
address: 280 Broadway Gibney: Agnes Varis Performing Arts Center, Civic Center/Tribeca

title: Opera Italiana in Central Park: Opera Unbound: A Sunset Serenade
description: Opera is in the air at Central Park’s Naumburg Bandshell, featuring selections by Verdi, Leoncavallo, Mascagni, Puccini, and Rossini. Free admission.

title: Letters + Sodas: LIC Reading Series
description: Writer Lana Schwartz brings together comedians and writers for a night of standup, humor pieces, fiction, and essay readings.

title: Not in My Backyard! A Political Comedy Roundtable
description: A panel of opinionated NYC comedians, journalists, and politicians debate local issues causing drama in your neighborhood’s Facebook group.

title: Artists + Beers
description: Pair cinema with cervezas at 'Artists + Beers', a semi-monthly screening series highlighting short films, docs, and music videos by local filmmakers.

title: We Have Fun: A Stand-Up Show
description: Hosts Zach Sims and Dan Wilbur bring the fun-ny to Young Ethel’s with stand-up by various comedians.

title: Ditmas Lit
description: A diverse range of fiction writers, storytellers, poets, and essayists share their work at the Ditmas Lit series.

title: Comedy on Kingston
description: The Comedy on Kingston show returns with a night of stand-up featuring various comedians.

title: Fightin’ Words! A Language Game Show
description: Three contestants compete in a series of word-based games to win the ultimate prize: a new word of their creation will be added to the people’s lexicon.

title: Target Margin Theater's The Degenerate Lab
description: For the first time since the pandemic, the Target Margin Theater lab returns with The Degenerate Lab, a series of productions answering the question, ‘what is degenerate art now?’. Tickets start at $20.

title: Myrtle Avenue Negroni Week
description: Raise a glass at this week-long celebration of the iconic Italian cocktail! 10 local bars and restaurants will showcase exclusive menus. Each participating venue is also making a donation to Slow Food.

title: We Love a Theme: A Storytelling Show
description: A lineup of performers tell funny, heartwarming, and cringe-inducing tales at Bailey Swilley’s monthly storytelling show. Tonight’s ‘bad apples’ theme features Jenna Dioguardi, Kenice Mobley, Julie Piñero, and Mandy Wagnac.

title: Sixties Surreal at the Whitney
description: A new exhibition at the Whitney Museum explores how artists in 1960s America used surrealism to respond to the era’s social and political changes. The show features works by more than 100 artists.
cost: $30 general, $24 seniors/students, free for 25 and under
